text:
Hey guys it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies, the holidays are here, I love this

time of year, and I especially love it because
of holiday cookies!

One of my favorite holiday cookies of all
time are gingerbread cookies, and, a fun holiday

memory is my dad and I like to watch Star
Wars movies.
Also, over the years the character Chewie, who's the Wookiee has really been growing on me, becoming more
and more my favorite character.
He’s the one that talks like this, arrrrrrroooooooggggghhh!
That one…

I’ve loved him so much that I even started to
teach my dog Cookie, how to talk like a Wookiee,

to make Wookiee noises, I have a clip of it
from my phone, I’m gonna put it right here

you guys, check it out, I do it and then she
does it back.
Ro: Arrrooooogghhhhh…
Cookie: Arrrooooogghhhhh!
Adorable!

And, I’ve got her here today, she’s my
little helper, but she fell asleep and she’s

licking her lips because she can smell all
these yummy ingredients up here.

So, today, we are gonna be making Gingerbread
Wookiee Cookies, Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 3 cups
of all purpose flour, 1/2 a cup of molasses,

1/2 a cup of light brown sugar, 1 stick of
butter, 1 egg, 1 teaspoon of baking powder,

1/2 a teaspoon of baking soda, 1/4 teaspoon
of salt, 1/8 teaspoon of allspice, 1-1/2 teaspoons

of ground ginger, 2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon,
1/4 teaspoon of ground clove, and 2 teaspoons
of vanilla extract.

Then to decorate you’re gonna need dark
coating chocolate and white coating chocolate.
And a classic gingerbread man cookie cutter.
Now let’s put it all together!
A-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!

To make our gingerbread cookies, the first
thing that we’re gonna do is in a medium

bowl we’re gonna whisk together our dry
ingredients.

We’ve got our flour, baking powder, baking
soda, salt, cinnamon, allspice, ginger, and cloves.

I love the cloves, they really remind me of
the holidays.

I think it’s because it’s one of the ingredients
in the pumpkin spice latte.
Mah-moh, Starbucks!

Now mix together butter, sugar and molasses
in a large mixing bowl, I’m gonna be using

a hand mixer, and when we’re mixing it together,
it’s gonna look curdled, it’s not gonna
look light and fluffy and pretty.
Ro: Now you can smell that, huh Cookie?

Next we’re gonna add our egg and vanilla
extract.

Then we’re gonna mix it up again and using
a spatula, scrape down the sides.

And now, I’m gonna pour the dry ingredients
into the wet, we’re gonna do this 1/2 at a time.

Mix it up, scrape down the sides with a spatula
then pour in the second 1/2 of the dry ingredients,
mix it up, and scrape it down.

Our cookie dough is looking good, and it is
ready to chill.

Cut it in 1/2, using the spatula, and then
wrap it up tight.

I like to separate the dough into halves because
it makes it a little bit easier to work with

and when it sits in the fridge, it chills
a little faster.

Now we’re gonna pop both of these pieces
of dough into the fridge to chill for 1 hour.
Holiday Baking Flair!
Huh!
Double Wrapped!?
I forgot I double wrapped this one.
Baking Flair!
YES!

Pinch some flour, sprinkle it on top of our work
surface.
Put a little on top.
Roll it out about 1/4 inch thick.

Take your classic gingerbread cookie cutter,
and cut out a bunch of cookies.
Arrrooooogghhhhh!

We’ve got our cookies cut out, we’ve got
them on the baking sheet, they’re almost

ready to bake, but before we bake, we’re
gonna add some details to look like fur, using
a fork.
Because look how furry Wookiees are!
May the Fork be with you!

Press down to create some texture to look
like fur.

We’re gonna pop these in the oven at 350
degrees and bake them for about 15 minutes.

My house smells like Gingerbread, I’m so
excited!

So once your cookies have baked and had plenty
of time to cool, we’re going to decorate.
We’ve got coating chocolate, dark and white.

For those of you who aren’t familiar with
coating chocolate, it’s chocolate with a

little bit of wax, so when it’s re-heated
and piped, you won’t get little white swirls.

First thing that I’m gonna do is heat up
both the chocolates, I’m just gonna pop
these in the microwave.

I took the chocolate out of the microwave,
it’s nice and hot, I’m just gonna give

it a quick stir to break up any chunks that
haven’t been melted.

Chocolate is very heat sensitive, so you want
to pick one, do all of the decorations and
then move on to the next color.

Pour dark melted chocolate into a little piping
bag, with a number 3 tip at the end.

We’re gonna use the dark chocolate to pipe
Chewbacca’s belt, his eyes and nose.

Final decoration step, we’re gonna add some
details, using the white chocolate, pour it

again into a piping bag, and this one has
a number 2 tip at the end.

I’m gonna pipe 2 rows of dots down his diagonal
belt, and a little Wookiee mouth.

Now you’re gonna do this to the rest of
your cookies.
Ta-da!

Here are the Gingerbread Wookiee Cookies that
we made today, using a delicious homemade
Gingerbread Cookie recipe.

I just love these cookies because it is a
traditional holiday cookie, with a little
bit of a geeky twist.

I’ll be posting the recipes and a bunch
of pictures on RosannaPansino.com, Instagram,
Facebook and Twitter.

And if you guys make these please take a picture
and send it to me, I love seeing your baking

creations, it just makes me happy, it makes
my day.

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave me

a comment down below and I will do my best
to make it happen.

Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye, and
happy holidays!

Now I get to have one for me, I love this,
gingerbread cookies….
Ahhhh! OK.
Mmmm!
Mmm-mmmm!

I like the little hints of chocolate, it’s
not too overpowering, I can still taste my
gingerbread cookie.

Ooooh, before I forget, my baking assistant
wants to say goodbye, she’s sleeping, hold
on just a second.
Ugh, Cookie say bye, happy holidays!
Arrrrooogggghhh!
